key_mistakes.reason: Missed opportunity to strengthen control over the center
Blocks the d-pawn and decreases pressure on the center
Passive move, delaying kingside development and castling
Allows opponent to recapture with a knight, missing an opportunity to advance the pawn
Unnecessary exchange that loses material advantage
Misses the chance to block the a-pawn and create threats

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center with pawns and pieces early in the game.
Prioritize development and king safety by castling early.
Avoid unnecessary exchanges that weaken your position and lose material.
Consider pawn breaks that open up lines for your pieces and create threats.
